messages.message: Is there a maximum document length? Iâ€™ve got a 900+ page document which failed the digitisation step.
I've successded with a 700page one on prod. But UAT is not scaled as big i think

Its mostly a function of overall token count (so not directly correlated to number of pages).
We can go upto ~ 400-500K tokens before indexing step times out. So on average 500-600 pages is roughly the limit on average for what can be digitised successfully, documents with higher pages beyond will timeout and fail to process.
The limit here is on indexing (not the reader processing).
There are some chunked parallel indexing improvements planned ahead to speed it up - they need more performance characterisation before rolling them out.
Curious on what are the type of documents with 900+ pages ? @Lee
Here are some samples. They are fund prospectuses
The error messages suggested something failed in the OCR process. Would be clearer if it said that the document is too long to process
Thanks Lee. Let me try these files and confirm the failure mode here.
